page.title: 12RAMBLING AROUND GRANTHAM.
page.content: Recently, members of the Ramblers Assoiation in this district have reported that footpaths and routeways are in need of attention. Causes of deterioration are due both to man and nature. Some public ways become overgrown. Others have been ploughed out by local farmers as hedges are torn out fields enlarged and new farming systems introduced. Sign posts and direction markers are sometimes removed or allowed to fall into misuse or simply vandalised. There are parts of the area however which are very well cared for. Belton Park estate lands are once again open to the public thanks to the National Trust. Some restrictions have to be imposed for the safeguarding of livestock, mostly sheep, but the park offers a rich and varied rambling environment.
